project.name: Orion Edge Gateway
project.scope: API gateway, rate limiting, auth integration

sections.title: Project Context & Security Requirements
sections.goal: Understand the PO's perspective on project scope, security baselines, and regulatory constraints for the Orion Edge Gateway.
sample_questions: Can you walk me through the main functional goals of Orion Edge Gateway and how security is factored in from the outset?
What regulatory or compliance frameworks are most relevant here, and how do they shape your backlog?
How do you balance the SLA-ORI-02 latency target with security controls like mTLS?

sections.title: Integration Points & Risk Surfaces
sections.goal: Identify cross-system dependencies and potential risk vectors, especially related to authentication and data flow.
sample_questions: Which upstream and downstream systems integrate with Orion, and where do you see the largest attack surface?
How do you coordinate with the Aegis IAM team to ensure RB-IAM-075 runbook alignment?
Can you describe a scenario where rate limiting could inadvertently block legitimate traffic due to integration quirks?

sections.title: Incident Handling & Evidence-Based Decisions
sections.goal: Explore how the PO approaches incident response, evidence gathering, and post-mortem prioritization for security issues.
sample_questions: When GW-4821 MTLS handshake bug occurred, what was your prioritization rationale for the fix vs other feature work?
How do you ensure evidence from incidents feeds back into your RFCs and backlog grooming?
What are your criteria for accepting a security trade-off when under delivery pressure?

sections.title: Trade-offs, Risks, and Long-Term Strategy
sections.goal: Discuss strategic planning, risk acceptance, and alignment with company values and policies.
sample_questions: Given POL-SEC-001, how do you handle stakeholder pressure for broader permanent access in dev environments?
What long-term risks do you foresee if we scale Orion without rethinking our mTLS policy matrix?
How do you document and communicate these trade-offs to execs and auditors?
